title: Captain America’s, Ironman’s, and Thor’s anxiety and defense mechanism in The Avengers and Avengers: Age of Ultron
abstract: This thesis aims to discuss the anxiety and defence mechanism of three main characters of the superhero movies, namely, Marvel’s The Avengers and Avengers: Age of Ultron. The three main characters discussed have the capabilities to save the world. Yet, despite their capabilities as superheroes, they have their own weaknesses, just like human beings. In my analysis, I investigate the weaknesses of the main characters, namely, Captain America, Ironman, and Thor. Using Cramer’s concept of anxiety and defence mechanism (1991, 2009, 2016), I find that their weaknesses trigger anxiety. In return, their anxiety creates fear and guilt. These fear and guilt lead Captain America, Ironman, and Thor to developing their defence mechanism. However, each main character uses different kinds of defence mechanism. Captain America uses denial. Ironman uses denial and rationalization. Thor uses repression. To sum up, I conclude that although the main characters in The Avengers and The Avengers: Age of Ultron are superheroes, they have their own weaknesses and they are still human.
